author: PetSerAl
body: As file `testablescript.ps1` used in hash testing, it should be checked-out without any line ending correction.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: Why not generate the file instead of committing a binary file?

comments.author: PetSerAl
comments.body: @lzybkr Given that file is 14 bytes long, it would mean to embed file in tests directly. It could be done this way, but I do not see any benefits in changing it now.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Also we would remove \r\n at EOF. Although I agree that it's better to generate this file, it makes the tests more understandable and more reliable.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
There are benefits to self contained tests, 14 bytes means it's a very readable test too since the embedded file is so short.

If we were talking about a longer file, then I might feel differently.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Longer asserts files we have is for certificates - it seems no problems with them.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @PetSerAl Please add comment why the PR was closed. Thanks!

comments.author: PetSerAl
comments.body: @iSazonov It looks like @lzybkr prefer to include `testablescript.ps1` in tests directly, rather then keeping it as separate file in repository. That way this PR would be unnecessary.

title: Make testablescript.ps1 binary
